Package com.telenav.lexakai.indexes

Class ReadMeUpdater

All Implemented Interfaces:
com.telenav.kivakit.component.Component, com.telenav.kivakit.core.messaging.Broadcaster, com.telenav.kivakit.core.messaging.Listener, com.telenav.kivakit.core.messaging.MessageTransceiver, com.telenav.kivakit.core.messaging.Repeater, com.telenav.kivakit.core.messaging.Transceiver, com.telenav.kivakit.core.registry.RegistryTrait, com.telenav.kivakit.interfaces.messaging.Receiver, com.telenav.kivakit.interfaces.messaging.Transmitter, com.telenav.kivakit.interfaces.naming.Nameable, com.telenav.kivakit.interfaces.naming.NamedObject
public class ReadMeUpdater extends com.telenav.kivakit.component.BaseComponent
Updates the section indexes in the README.md file for a project.

Usage

The project is passed to the constructor. The update() method updates the read me file. The LexakaiProject.javadocSectionPattern() setting determines how Javadoc sections are located. The LexakaiProject.childProjects() setting provides a list of projects to index for projects with *pom* packaging (parent projects). Finally, the LexakaiProject.addHtmlAnchors() determines if anchor tags should be added to the sections that the index references.

Templates

The *lexakai-readme-template.md* and *lexakai-parent-readme-template.md* files serve as default templates for producing *README.md* documentation indexes for projects. The former creates *README.md* indexes for ordinary projects with Java source code, while the latter produces *README.md* indexes for Maven parent projects with *pom* packaging. Both templates are copied on the first run into the documentation folder where they can be modified to produce specific effects.

After the *README.md* file has been created on the first run, on subsequent runs, it is updated by extracting the portion of the file between *start-user-text* and *end-user-text* comments and inserting it back into the appropriate template.

Author:
jonathanl (shibo)
